intro: Rinorea gossweileri, commonly known as the velvetleaf. It is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae, native to tropical regions of South America. The plant is characterized by its soft, velvety leaves that give it its common name. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or white in color. Rinorea gossweileri is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
